review: a bit different from the first two games but good in its own way once i got used to the new 3d panoramic view of the camera i came to kinda love it it does make the games worlds feel as immersive as they can get while also keeping the classic movement system and interactivity i cant say that i liked the ages and the puzzles here quite as much as in the other games but they were still solid also loved the character of saavedro stellar performance from the actor
short and less memorable than the first 2 in the series but still follows the myst formula of creating a super interesting world with complex and challenging puzzles 7510
its fun

beautiful soundtrack amazing visuals interesting storyline challenging puzzles and a wonderful bit of nostalgia for this old fellow who remembers playing myst on my old mac back when it came out so many many years ago
not as good as riven but still fun to play
its ok though i wish their was a remake
its a smart game requires you to think
best of all the myst games still beats modern graphics
a fun game where you learn a bit more about the past how things work and also have different endings the ages are also very unique and great to explore
a fun sequel and beautiful as well 910 would play again
riveting exciting kept me on the edge of my seat

myst iii exile is fantastic i played the original games back when they were first released some 30 years ago i loved the games then and i am reliving the games all over again now they have brought back the complete series from the original myst to myst v i hope everyone can get to enjoy playing myst today as i had enjoyed playing them when they were first released

great game puzzles were challenging but not impossible sometimes got stuck as paths were not very clear but you cant expect anything else from an old game feeling very accomplished after finishing this

a myst game done by the crew behind the journeyman project trilogy it is a mix of approaches in a sense that also highlights the best and the worst from presto they seem to take themselves even more seriously than cyan but their fantasyscience fiction point of view works wonders here now same backtracking feast as any of the myst sequels which makes puzzle solving mostly a matter of patience

this is perhaps my favourite from the myst series i loved it back when it was released and i still remember the big box that came with multiple cds and a printed manual i guess i still have it somewhere ive revisited it now and i still find it fascinating especially the amateria ending sequence easier than riven but its still a demanding and satisfying challenge and overall a great puzzle game

hi   absolutely love this game  played it many years ago  i am very ancient in age and recently bought a refurbished laptop to play as its not on ipads  being older myst 3 has no fighting just amazing graphics and doable puzzles forcing the mind to work hard  i think it holds its own in the modern gaming age taking one to a mystical place  away from the modern world thank you steam for keeping this game ak

its very addictive

myst iii exile is by far my favorite of the cyan series its elegant design and questdriven narrative direct the player to deeper realms of imagination and queries into the human condition its thoughtprovoking puzzles are rewarding to finish the characters are complex as the game is sophisticated it maintains the characteristic labyrinthine beauty and haunting atmosphere this is a masterpiece

same kinda play as 1 and 2 with a twist on the puzzles
i have always loved these games it is such joy to com back to them

fun not as intriguing or impressive as riven from a worldbuilding perspective but the story is intriguing and adds depth to the characters puzzles are just tricky enough in my opinion  they combine the conspicuousness of mysts puzzles with rivens more inquisitive method of solving them so it strikes a nice balance its a shame about the company switch though  cyans involvement really added something special that is missing from this game
loved all the graphicsbeautiful story with good ending maybeif you choose the right one

i love puzzles and hate killing things even if in a game setting  myst exhile continues the fun of other myst games  riven is my favorite but i just love all of them  my only problem is a get motion sick but play in small in doses and you will get to the end  enjoy

this is one of my favorite parts of the series only to be topped by riven exile is a beautiful game with an amazing soundtrack the atmosphere in the different worlds can sometimes even be quite unsettling as they look so abandoned and lifeless while being exceptionally beautiful brad dourif as the antagonist is doing a phenomenal job and is certainly carrying the mood of the game much recommended for everyone who liked the first two parts

beautiful worlds fantastic machines its slightly too easy to get the bad ending first time through so riven is still my favourite of the myst series but ive explored the worlds of exile many times too over the years and got stuck at some of the same places its iveryi satisfying when you figure it out for yourself though

i love the myst games and exile is no exception it has brad dourif in it he does an excellent job as saavedros exile has great puzzles that will challenge just about any player the graphics are great when taking the original release date into consideration my favorite age is amateria the marble puzzle is a lot of fun definitely recommended to anyone who likes puzzle games and is a mustplay for fans of myst and riven

im playing all of the myst games in order and so far myst 3 is my favorite if youve played myst andor riven you will have a good idea of what to expect here but i think that myst 3 has the most logical puzzles of the three not quite as cryptic as some of the puzzles in myst not quite as obtuse as the massive overarching puzzle in riven just an excellent puzzle game in the myst tradition i highly recommend attempting this game without any walkthroughs

very strategic challenge

another great game in the myst series looks great for being over 20 years old  some sequences in particular are spectacular amateria pinball in particular the free look is a great addition to the games and works perfectly  its quite a bit easier than riven as almost all the puzzles are selfcontained and dont require you to backtrack to different islands nevertheless its a great game and you should play it maybe get it on sale as its rather expensive for being so old

continues the myst tradition in all its excellence my favorite in the series so far just a touch easier than riven which is a good thing a great story with multiple endings and the ability to look around freely a first for the series
